description: APPLICATION FOR A LAWFUL DEVELOPMENT CERTIFICATE IN RESPECT OF THE PROPOSED ERECTION OF REAR ROOF DORMER WITH 3X ROOFLIGHTS IN FRONT ROOF SLOPE AND ALTERATIONS TO DOORS AND FENESTRATION ON FLANK ELEVATION
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The operations comprising the erection of a rear roof dormer extension would consist of the enlargement of a dwelling house within the meaning of Class B of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town & Country Planning (General Permitted Development)  (England) Order 2015 "the Order" and would comply with the development tolerances set out in said Class B. The operation would therefore have been granted planning permission by Article 3 of the Order.

Condition : 2 - The operations comprising the installation of three roof lights in the front roof slope and obscure glazed fixed shut windows at first and upper floors would consist of any other alteration to the roof of the dwelling house within the meaning of Class C of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town & Country Planning (General Permitted Development)  (England) Order 2015 "the Order" and would comply with the development tolerances set out in said Class C. The operation would therefore have been granted planning permission by Article 3 of the Order.

Condition : 3 - The operations comprising the blocking up of the ground floor flank door and changes to the ground floor flank window would consist of a non-material alteration to the external appearance of the building within the meaning of Section 55 (2) Town & Country Planning Act 1990 and the (General Permitted Development) (Amendment) (No. 2) (England) Order 2008 "the Order" and would therefore not constitute development as defined in Section 55 (2) and the relevant parts of the Act.
